comments:
Encountered this in WSAD and spoke with our EJB Mapping guru about this issue.
I was told that this is a known workbench problem that has no defect, so I'm 
opening one here. As I understand it, this issue should be fixed soon, but I 
believe it needs a defect for our tracking purposes on this end.

Description: When creating a mapping on an EJB project for the first time, I 
had left our deployment descriptor and the mapping editor open.  I then 
proceeded to generate deploy code, which caused changes in the open deployment 
descriptor and the following stacktrace once ejbdeploy started running.  
(ejbdeploy is not currently saving the descriptor before kicking off the deploy 
code generation)

When i next tried to cause this problem (on the same project), it wouldn't show 
up again.  If I, however, created another ejb project and went through the 
steps described, I could reproduce it everytime.

Here's the exception i get:
